attributes.background:
Transponders enable Air Traffic Controllers to have more information about aircraft than a return on a radar screen. Transponders do this by transmitting from the aircraft. Mode S transponders identify the aircraft that is transmitting, enabling it to be traced and providing Controllers with information about aircraft type, speed and performance.

For most owners of light aircraft, fitting a Mode S transponder is an additional cost (between £700 and £3,000) without any benefit. The advantage is to airlines and other commercial operators, who won’t have to pay anything. 

We request that the Prime Minister asks for a review of this by his Ministerial colleagues.

government_responses.details:
You recently signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "prevail on the Civil Aviation Authority not to ignore the findings of its consultation with General Aviation on the mandatory imposition of Mode S equipment. Only 1% of those surveyed approved the mandatory imposition on all aircraft, yet this seems certain to go ahead."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number-10.gov.uk/output/Page11853.asp
